name: Bill's Creamy Shredded Chicken Soup
author: Bill Falk
summary: This is a full-flavored, rich, and creamy shredded chicken soup recipe that is not only good as a dish base, but just plain good on its own. No added salt, and only a small amount of low-sodium chicken broth. Garnish with parsley and Cheddar cheese.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil, or more to taste
½ teaspoon finely chopped fresh garlic
1 ½ teaspoons salt-free seasoning blend (such as Mrs. Dash®)
½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
directions: Heat oil in a 3- to 4-quart saucepan over medium heat
Add onion and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute
Gradually stir in flour to form a paste
Add shredded chicken, chicken broth, sour cream, salt-free seasoning blend, pepper, garlic powder, and celery seed; bring to a rolling boil
Reduce heat and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes
Stir in cubed chicken and heat for 10 minutes
Add cornstarch and thicken to desired consistency
